original: Håkanson, Hilda Linnea, läroverksadjunkt, Falköping, f. 18/3/09 i Alingsås av Linus H. o. Hilda Åberg. — Stud:ex. v. S. Rudebecks sk. 27, fil. mag. i Upps. 34, provår v. södra latin i Sthlm 39-40. Stud:res. t. TyskL, Tjeckoslov., Österr., Ital. o. Frankr. 30, Finl. 31, Danm. 33, Norge 34, Tyskl. 36. Timlär. i Mora 33-34, vik. ämneslär. i Svalöv 34-35, e. lär. v. Väs- terås elemilärov. f. fl. 35-36, timlär. i Uddevalla 36-37, e. lär. i Uddevalla 37, vik. ämneslär. i Karlsborg 38, e. adj. i Uddevalla 38-39, dito i Skara 40-42, e. o. adj. där 43-45, adj. i geogr., matem. o. fysik v. Falköp. samrealsk. sed. 45.
translated: Hakanson, Hilda Linnea, high school teacher, Falkoping, b. March 18, 1909 in Alingsas to Linus H. and Hilda Aberg. She passed her high school exams at S. Rudebecks sk. in 1927, received a degree in Philosophy from Uppsala University in 1934, a probationary year at Southern Latin in Stockholm in 1939-1940. She traveled to Germany, Czechoslovakia, Austria, Italy, France, Finland, Denmark, and Norway for study in 1930, 1931, 1933, and 1934. She worked as an hourly teacher in Mora in 1933-1934, substituted as a subject teacher in Svalov in 1934-1935, a full-time teacher at Vasteras elementary school in 1935-1936, an hourly teacher in Uddevalla in 1936-1937, a full-time teacher in Uddevalla from 1937, a substitute subject teacher in Karlsborg in 1938, a full-time teacher in Uddevalla in 1938-1939, a full-time teacher in Skara in 1940-1942, an extra substitute teacher there from 1943-1945, and then a teacher in geography, math, and physics at Falkoping Samrealskola from 1945 onwards.

issuedBy.name: Germany, Czechoslovakia, Austria, Italy, France, Finland, Denmark, and Norway
